frameDefinitions: This frame concerns the inception of the life of a Child, generally human, at a particular Time and Place.
Due to internal forces/properties, an Entity is inclined towards a particular Behavior, which may be to perform an action or to maintain a state.
An Entity develops from a Prior_state to a Post_state.
A Grower endeavors to tend to and influence the environment of Food so as to foster its growth.
A Mother and Father produce a Child or an Egg. 'Betty bore Gerry three intelligent daughters.'
A salient Subevent has a Pattern of recurrence within a larger Process.
frameExamples: Little Jessie <t>came into the world</t> at 8 last night.
Tony's fingers tapped <t>rhythmically</t> on the keyboard
listRoleDefinitions: <fen>Child</fen> identifies the new self-motile creature.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the birth occurs, generally expressed as a date or a year.
The location where the <fen>Child</fen> enters the world.
TheFrame Element <fen>Entity</fen> identifies the person or thing that has a tendency towards some Behaviour.
The role <fen>Behavior</fen> marks expressions that indicate which state or action the <fen>Entity</fen> tends towards.
The part of the <fen>Organism</fen> which is undergoing biological development.
The living thing whose <fen>Entity</fen> is undergoing development.
The relevant dimension of development.  Usually expressed by an entity-denoting adjective.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Entity</fen> develops.
The location where the <fen>Entity</fen> develops.
The <fen>Grower</fen> is the agent growing <fen>Food</fen>.

<fex name='Food'>Food</fex> is the item grown by the <fen>Grower</fen>, which can include things not traditionally eaten, like flowers, etc., or items for other consumption-related uses, like medicines, smokables, etc.
When the growing event occurs.
The greater geographic location where the <fen>Grower</fen> grows <fen>Food</fen>.
<fen>Mother</fen> is the female creature that produces the <fen>Child</fen>.
<fen>Child</fen> identifies the new self-motile creature produced from the <fen>Mother</fen> and <fen>Father</fen>.
<fen>Father</fen> is the male creature that copulates with the <fen>Mother</fen>, thus  leading to the birth of the <fen>Child</fen>.
<fen>Egg</fen> is an immobile object containing an organism that may hatch as a mobile, infant organism.
The <fen>Mother</fen> and <fen>Father</fen> expressed together.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the event occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the event occurs.
The larger event that is characterized by the recurring Subevents.
The salient, punctual event that is construed as part of a <fen>Process</fen>.
The <fen>Pattern</fen> that can be detected in the recurrence of  the <fen>Subevent</fen>s of the <fen>Process</fen> .
listRoleExamples: <fex>Lubomir</fex> was not inclined to believe me
Martha has a tendency <fex>to overdo the housekeeping</fex>.
The development <fex>of a human embryo</fex> is fascinating to study.
Rachel studies nervous system development <fex>in apes</fex>.
<fex>Embryonic</fex> development had been stunted by the disease.
<fex>Someday</fex> this bud will grow into a rose.
The cells were developing rapidly <fex>in the Petri dish</fex>.
Female clownfish lay <fex>their eggs</fex> around sea anemones
<fex>We</fex> are going to be having twins!
The rhythm <fex>of the rain falling on the roof</fex> kept me awake
The music had a driving rhythm

sourceCandidateSpans.text: the Coronation of Tsar Alexander III
